alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Fleming; Morgan; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Morgan, northeastern Bath, southeastern Fleming, southern Rowan and Elliott Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grayson Lake State Park to Wagner Store to near Grange City. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wagner Store, Minor, Wagner, Farley, Elliottville, Hamm, Vale and Stark around 230 PM EDT. Fannin Valley and Blairs Mills around 235 PM EDT. Lytten, Bruin and Newfoundland around 240 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Sandy Hook, Little Sandy, Brandy, Clearfield, Cogswell, Culver, Zilpo, Lick Fork, Isonville, Pelfrey and Craney. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 129 and 139. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
